item.description:
Boston Value Investing Group

We learn from Warren Buffett and Benjamin Graham. We use publicly available financial reports.

The meeting format is as follows:
Raimondas Lencevicius will argue, in a double-billing, why or why not we should invest in:
  • Shanda (SNDA)
  • Corning (GLW)



Raimondas will start the meeting with discussion of "The Intelligent Investor: The Definitive Book on Value Investing. A Book of Practical Counsel" by Benjamin Graham, Jason Zweig, and Warren E. Buffett. Please consider reading the book over the holidays.

The 12/10/08 meeting notes are available:
  • PowerPoint with the main information - here
  • Word document showing financial statement analysis - here



We will meet at the entrance doors of MIT's Stata Center at 6:30pm. Specifically, the meeting point is the entrance to Building 32 (also known as the Gates Building) on Main Street and Vassar Street. We will then use room G725 in the Stata Center. The doors are only accessible with an MIT card, so please arrive on time. Here's a campus map showing the Stata Center.
